intro: Microdactylon, commonly known as the sea holly, is a genus of flowering plants belonging to the family Apiaceae. It is characterized by its distinctive, often spiny leaves and small, yellowish flowers that bloom in clusters. These plants are typically found in coastal areas and saline soils, showcasing their adaptability to harsh environments. Microdactylon species are often used in horticulture for their ornamental value and ability to thrive in difficult conditions. Their botanical features make them an interesting subject for ecological and botanical study.
